channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Cone: Unsupervised Contrastive Opinion Extraction
item.description: Contrastive opinion extraction aims to extract a structured summary or key points organised as positive and negative viewpoints towards a common aspect or topic.

item.title: Is AUC the best measure for practical comparison of anomaly detectors?
item.description: The area under receiver operating characteristics (AUC) is the standard measure for comparison of anomaly detectors.

item.title: Gaussian process deconvolution
item.description: Let us consider the deconvolution problem, that is, to recover a latent source $x(\cdot)$ from the observations $\y = [y_1,\ldots, y_N]$ of a convolution process $y = x\star h + \eta$, where $\eta$ is an additive noise, the observations in $\y$ might have missing parts with respect to $y$, and the filter $h$ could be unknown.

item.title: MultiTACRED: A Multilingual Version of the TAC Relation Extraction Dataset
item.description: Relation extraction (RE) is a fundamental task in information extraction, whose extension to multilingual settings has been hindered by the lack of supervised resources comparable in size to large English datasets such as TACRED (Zhang et al., 2017).

item.title: Compressed Video Quality Assessment for Super-Resolution: a Benchmark and a Quality Metric
item.description: We assessed 17 state-ofthe-art SR models using our benchmark and evaluated their ability to preserve scene context and their susceptibility to compression artifacts.

item.title: Behavior Contrastive Learning for Unsupervised Skill Discovery
item.description: Under mild assumptions, our objective maximizes the MI between different behaviors based on the same skill, which serves as an upper bound of the previous MI objective.

item.title: Can Diffusion Model Achieve Better Performance in Text Generation? Bridging the Gap between Training and Inference!
item.description: Diffusion models have been successfully adapted to text generation tasks by mapping the discrete text into the continuous space.

item.title: LMPT: Prompt Tuning with Class-Specific Embedding Loss for Long-tailed Multi-Label Visual Recognition
item.description: Long-tailed multi-label visual recognition (LTML) task is a highly challenging task due to the label co-occurrence and imbalanced data distribution.

item.title: PillarNeXt: Rethinking Network Designs for 3D Object Detection in LiDAR Point Clouds
item.description: In order to deal with the sparse and unstructured raw point clouds, LiDAR based 3D object detection research mostly focuses on designing dedicated local point aggregators for fine-grained geometrical modeling.

item.title: Scalable Optimal Margin Distribution Machine
item.description: Optimal margin Distribution Machine (ODM) is a newly proposed statistical learning framework rooting in the novel margin theory, which demonstrates better generalization performance than the traditional large margin based counterparts.

item.title: Global Update Tracking: A Decentralized Learning Algorithm for Heterogeneous Data
item.description: Decentralized learning enables the training of deep learning models over large distributed datasets generated at different locations, without the need for a central server.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning for Topic Models
item.description: We apply reinforcement learning techniques to topic modeling by replacing the variational autoencoder in ProdLDA with a continuous action space reinforcement learning policy.

item.title: Local Optimization Achieves Global Optimality in Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Motivated by the observation, we present a multi-agent PPO algorithm in which the local policy of each agent is updated similarly to vanilla PPO.

item.title: New metrics and search algorithms for weighted causal DAGs
item.description: Recovering causal relationships from data is an important problem.

item.title: A-ePA*SE: Anytime Edge-Based Parallel A* for Slow Evaluations
item.description: Anytime search algorithms are useful for planning problems where a solution is desired under a limited time budget.

item.title: The Signature Kernel
item.description: The signature kernel is a positive definite kernel for sequential data.

item.title: Efficient Reinforcement Learning for Autonomous Driving with Parameterized Skills and Priors
item.description: Inspired by this, we propose ASAP-RL, an efficient reinforcement learning algorithm for autonomous driving that simultaneously leverages motion skills and expert priors.

item.title: Target-Side Augmentation for Document-Level Machine Translation
item.description: Document-level machine translation faces the challenge of data sparsity due to its long input length and a small amount of training data, increasing the risk of learning spurious patterns.

item.title: Event Knowledge Incorporation with Posterior Regularization for Event-Centric Question Answering
item.description: In particular, we define event-related knowledge constraints based on the event trigger annotations in the QA datasets, and subsequently use them to regularize the posterior answer output probabilities from the backbone pre-trained language models used in the QA setting.

item.title: Breaking Through the Haze: An Advanced Non-Homogeneous Dehazing Method based on Fast Fourier Convolution and ConvNeXt
item.description: To tackle these two challenges, we propose a novel two branch network that leverages 2D discrete wavelete transform (DWT), fast Fourier convolution (FFC) residual block and a pretrained ConvNeXt model.

item.title: Toward Adversarial Training on Contextualized Language Representation
item.description: Based on the observation, we propose simple yet effective \textit{Contextualized representation-Adversarial Training} (CreAT), in which the attack is explicitly optimized to deviate the contextualized representation of the encoder.

item.title: MGR: Multi-generator based Rationalization
item.description: Rationalization is to employ a generator and a predictor to construct a self-explaining NLP model in which the generator selects a subset of human-intelligible pieces of the input text to the following predictor.

item.title: A Multi-Modal Context Reasoning Approach for Conditional Inference on Joint Textual and Visual Clues
item.description: This makes the language model well-suitable for such multi-modal reasoning scenario on joint textual and visual clues.

item.title: Toeplitz Neural Network for Sequence Modeling
item.description: Sequence modeling has important applications in natural language processing and computer vision.

item.title: AnomalyBERT: Self-Supervised Transformer for Time Series Anomaly Detection using Data Degradation Scheme
item.description: Mechanical defects in real situations affect observation values and cause abnormalities in multivariate time series, such as sensor values or network data.

item.title: XAI in Computational Linguistics: Understanding Political Leanings in the Slovenian Parliament
item.description: We develop both classical machine learning and transformer language models to predict the left- or right-leaning of parliamentarians based on their given speeches on the topic of migrants.

item.title: CSGCL: Community-Strength-Enhanced Graph Contrastive Learning
item.description: Graph Contrastive Learning (GCL) is an effective way to learn generalized graph representations in a self-supervised manner, and has grown rapidly in recent years.

item.title: Graph Masked Autoencoder for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: While some powerful neural network architectures (e. g., Transformer, Graph Neural Networks) have achieved improved performance in sequential recommendation with high-order item dependency modeling, they may suffer from poor representation capability in label scarcity scenarios.

item.title: Prompted LLMs as Chatbot Modules for Long Open-domain Conversation
item.description: In this paper, we propose MPC (Modular Prompted Chatbot), a new approach for creating high-quality conversational agents without the need for fine-tuning.

item.title: ElasticHash: Semantic Image Similarity Search by Deep Hashing with Elasticsearch
item.description: It is based on a deep hashing model to learn hash codes for fine-grained image similarity search in natural images and a two-stage method for efficiently searching binary hash codes using Elasticsearch (ES).

item.title: MultiModal-GPT: A Vision and Language Model for Dialogue with Humans
item.description: To further enhance the ability to chat with humans of the MultiModal-GPT, we utilize language-only instruction-following data to train the MultiModal-GPT jointly.

item.title: Language Independent Neuro-Symbolic Semantic Parsing for Form Understanding
item.description: Our model parses a form into a word-relation graph in order to identify entities and relations jointly and reduce the time complexity of inference.

item.title: Creative Discovery using QD Search
item.description: In creative design, where aesthetics play a crucial role in determining the quality of outcomes, there are often multiple worthwhile possibilities, rather than a single ``best'' design.

item.title: Non-Autoregressive Math Word Problem Solver with Unified Tree Structure
item.description: For the second issue, to handle the variants in evaluation, we propose to match the unified tree and design a path-based metric to evaluate the partial accuracy of expression.

item.title: Pedestrian Behavior Maps for Safety Advisories: CHAMP Framework and Real-World Data Analysis
item.description: It is critical for vehicles to prevent any collisions with pedestrians.

item.title: HistAlign: Improving Context Dependency in Language Generation by Aligning with History
item.description: Cache-LMs, which augment LMs with a memory of recent history, can increase context dependency and have shown remarkable performance in diverse language generation tasks.

item.title: Understanding Noise-Augmented Training for Randomized Smoothing
item.description: This method relies on taking a majority vote of any base classifier over multiple noise-perturbed inputs to obtain a smoothed classifier, and it remains the tool of choice to certify deep and complex neural network models.

item.title: Robust Image Ordinal Regression with Controllable Image Generation
item.description: Image ordinal regression has been mainly studied along the line of exploiting the order of categories.

item.title: Bi-Mapper: Holistic BEV Semantic Mapping for Autonomous Driving
item.description: In addition, another stream of methods without prior knowledge can learn the transformation between front perspective views and BEV implicitly with a global view.

item.title: Cross-Modal Retrieval for Motion and Text via MildTriple Loss
item.description: Previous work on motion data modeling mainly relied on autoregressive feature extractors that may forget previous information, while we propose an innovative model that includes simple yet powerful transformer-based motion and text encoders, which can learn representations from the two different modalities and capture long-term dependencies.

item.title: RFR-WWANet: Weighted Window Attention-Based Recovery Feature Resolution Network for Unsupervised Image Registration
item.description: The Swin transformer has recently attracted attention in medical image analysis due to its computational efficiency and long-range modeling capability, which enables the establishment of more distant relationships between corresponding voxels.

item.title: Contrastive Enhanced Slide Filter Mixer for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: Sequential recommendation (SR) aims to model user preferences by capturing behavior patterns from their item historical interaction data.

item.title: MIReAD: Simple Method for Learning High-quality Representations from Scientific Documents
item.description: Learning semantically meaningful representations from scientific documents can facilitate academic literature search and improve performance of recommendation systems.

item.title: Dual Residual Attention Network for Image Denoising
item.description: The proposed DRANet includes two different parallel branches, which can capture complementary features to enhance the learning ability of the model.

item.title: Train a Real-world Local Path Planner in One Hour via Partially Decoupled Reinforcement Learning and Vectorized Diversity
item.description: Meanwhile, the Sparrow simulator utilizes a 2D grid-based world, simplified kinematics, and conversion-free data flow to achieve a lightweight design.

item.title: Context-Aware Chart Element Detection
item.description: As a prerequisite of chart data extraction, the accurate detection of chart basic elements is essential and mandatory.

item.title: MrTF: Model Refinery for Transductive Federated Learning
item.description: We propose a novel learning paradigm named transductive federated learning (TFL) to simultaneously consider the structural information of the to-be-inferred data.

item.title: PiML Toolbox for Interpretable Machine Learning Model Development and Validation
item.description: PiML (read $\pi$-ML, /`pai.`em.`el/) is an integrated and open-access Python toolbox for interpretable machine learning model development and model diagnostics.

item.title: Unified Demonstration Retriever for In-Context Learning
item.description: To train UDR, we cast various tasks' training signals into a unified list-wise ranking formulation by language model's feedback.

item.title: Heterogeneous Directed Hypergraph Neural Network over abstract syntax tree (AST) for Code Classification
item.description: In this study, we propose to represent AST as a heterogeneous directed hypergraph (HDHG) and process the graph by heterogeneous directed hypergraph neural network (HDHGN) for code classification.
